messages.content: Hi. I'm... I'm not sure where to start today. Things have been really overwhelming lately, especially after getting my midterm grade back.

feedback.summary: The therapist demonstrated a basic understanding of CBT principles, effectively identifying automatic thoughts related to the client's academic stress. However, the session lacked depth in exploring core beliefs and employing structured cognitive restructuring techniques. The therapist encouraged client reflection and initial reframing but could improve by setting more collaborative and specific homework tasks. More nuanced use of Socratic questioning could enhance client engagement with the cognitive model.

strengths: Recognized the impact of academic performance on client's self-perception
Initiated discussion on how grades influence self-esteem
areas_for_improvement: Probe further to uncover core beliefs about self-worth related to grades
Encourage exploration of broader life values and beliefs

strengths: Used questions to encourage client self-reflection
Facilitated exploration of client's thought patterns
areas_for_improvement: Utilize more open-ended questions to deepen understanding
Avoid leading questions that may suggest advice-giving

strengths: Encouraged client reflection on actionable steps
Supported client in identifying specific tasks to work on
areas_for_improvement: Ensure homework is collaboratively set with clear goals
Follow up on previous homework to assess its impact

strengths: Identified automatic thoughts related to academic stress
Provided initial guidance on reframing negative thoughts
areas_for_improvement: Explore deeper into underlying beliefs related to academic performance
Use more structured techniques to challenge distorted thinking
